item.title: 希腊要求英国法院就回购 GDP 认股权证的争议作出裁决
item.description: 希腊正将有关其国内生产总值认股权证的争议提交给英国法院，这是最新一个卷入与经济增长挂钩的债务工具持有者之争的国家。【原文：Greece is taking a dispute over its GDP warrants to a court in the UK, the latest nation to become embroiled in a battle with holders of the growth-linked debt instruments.】

item.title: 美国鸡蛋价格从历史最高点跌至每打 5 美元
item.description: 鸡蛋价格从上个月的历史高位回落了 18%，随着供应从禽流感的冲击中恢复过来，鸡蛋价格有所缓解，但关税带来了成本上升的风险。【原文：Egg prices pulled back 18% from a record high last month, offering some relief as supplies recovered from bird flu shock, though tariffs risk higher costs ahead.】

item.title: 通胀疲软支撑美联储 2025 年两次降息的赌注，美国债券上涨
item.description: 在一份备受关注的通胀报告低于预期之后，美国国债上涨，为美联储今年至少两次降息的赌注提供了支持。【原文：US Treasuries gained after a closely watched inflation report came in below expectations, offering support for wagers on at least two Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: MrBeast 与 Jack Link's 合作推出牛肉干和牛肉条系列
item.description:
这位拥有超过 3.9 亿粉丝的 YouTube 明星为其不断增长的食品组合增添了新成员

。【原文：

The YouTube star with more than 390 million followers adds to his growing food portfolio

】

item.title: 美国通胀率连续第三个月低于预期
item.description: 美国 4 月份消费者物价涨幅连续第三个月低于预期，表明通胀压力有限，但由于企业希望转嫁更高的关税成本，通胀压力仍有上升的风险。【原文：US consumer prices rose by less than forecast in April for a third month, indicating limited inflationary pressures that remain at risk of building as companies look to pass on the cost of higher tariffs.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金将在特朗普访问期间订购 30 架波音 737 飞机
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普本周的中东之行中，沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金将订购 30 架波音公司的单通道飞机。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is set to order 30 Boeing Co. single-aisle aircraft, as the kingdom lines up deals during President Donald Trump’s Middle East trip this week.】

item.title: 瑞银罗明称投资者从美国转向黄金和加密货币
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）亚洲财富管理联席主管表示，该集团的富裕客户正越来越多地放弃美元资产，转而投资黄金、加密货币和中国市场。【原文：UBS Group AG’s rich clients are increasingly shifting away from US-dollar assets, turning instead to gold, crypto and investments in China, according to the Swiss bank’s co-head of wealth management for Asia.】

item.title: 收购公司加大债务交易以支付股息
item.description: 在收购公司面临向客户返还资金的压力之际，一些公司正在推出一些旨在向私募股权所有者分红的债务交易。【原文：Companies are launching a number of debt deals designed to pay out a dividend to their private equity owners, at a time when buyout firms are under pressure to return money to clients.】

item.title: 巴西央行承诺长期实行紧缩货币政策
item.description: 根据本周二公布的上一次利率决议的会议纪要，巴西央行认为，由于通胀预测不稳定，有必要在更长时期内采取紧缩货币政策。【原文：Brazil’s central bank sees the need for tighter monetary policy for a longer period due to unanchored inflation forecasts, according to the minutes to the last interest rate decision published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 氮气公司为避免欧元债券违约进行最后谈判
item.description: 匈牙利资金紧张的化肥生产商 Nitrogenmuvek 公司首席战略官 Zoltan Bige 说，该公司正与债权人进行 "非常积极的 "谈判，以延长一天后到期的 2 亿欧元（2.22 亿美元）债券的期限。【原文：Nitrogenmuvek, Hungary’s cash-strapped fertilizer maker, is locked in “very active” negotiations with creditors to extend the maturity of a €200 million ($222 million) bond that’s due in a day, Chief Strategy Officer Zoltan Bige said.】

item.title: 剑龙物流称有信心实现全年两位数增长
item.description: 京东物流公司（JD Logistics Inc.【原文：JD Logistics Inc. said it’s confident of delivering double-digit growth for the year and aims to gain more market share in the premium logistics service segment.】

item.title: Bharti Airtel 因一次性税收收益而实现超预期利润
item.description: Bharti Airtel Ltd. 公布的季度利润超出预期，因为这家印度第二大无线运营商受益于一次性税收收益，并继续获得新用户。【原文：Bharti Airtel Ltd. posted quarterly profit that beat expectations, as India’s No. 2 wireless carrier benefited from a one-time tax gain and continued to gain new subscribers.】

item.title: 中美贸易停战后摩根大通放弃美国经济衰退观点
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted its forecast for US economic growth after a temporary trade deal between the US and China, dropping its earlier call that the world’s largest economy would sink into a recession in 2025.】

item.title: 特朗普已经毁了圣诞节
item.description:
即使总统明天取消关税，他也会引发一系列供应链冲击，给消费者带来货架之外的痛苦。【原文：

Even if the president were to call off the tariffs tomorrow, he’s unleashed a series of supply chain shocks that will cause consumers pain beyond store shelves.

】

item.title: Audible 将与出版商合作制作人工智能语音有声读物
item.description:
有声读物平台希望 "缩小 "现有印刷和电子图书与有声读物数量之间的 "差距"

。【原文：

The audiobook platform wants to ‘close the gap’ between the number of print and e-books in existence and audiobooks

】

item.title: 印度贸易部长将于本周访问美国讨论关税问题
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，印度贸易部长皮尤什-戈亚尔（Piyush Goyal）预计将于5月17日至20日前往美国与特朗普政府官员举行会谈，因为新德里威胁要对一些美国商品征收报复性关税。【原文：India’s Trade Minister Piyush Goyal is expected to travel to the US on May 17-20 to hold talks with Trump administration officials as New Delhi threatens to impose retaliatory tariffs on some American goods, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美国 4 月份 CPI 报告分析
item.description: 旧金山的购物者。摄影师：大卫-保罗-莫里斯/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Shoppers in San Francisco. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg】

item.title: 南非电力公司（Eskom）计划在周四进行滚动停电
item.description: 南非国有电力公司计划在周四晚间进行滚动停电，以管理有限的发电能力。【原文：South Africa’s state-owned power utility plans rolling blackouts through Thursday evening to manage limited generation capacity.】

item.title: 捷克央行称服务成本要求采取谨慎政策
item.description: 捷克中央银行表示，捷克的服务成本仍然是价格稳定的主要风险，需要采取谨慎的货币政策立场。【原文：Czech costs of services remain a key risk for price stability and require a cautious monetary-policy stance, according to the central bank.】

item.title: 石油交易员扫描特朗普中东之行的信号
item.description:
美国总统本周对海湾能源巨头的访问可能会使原油价格波动。【原文：

The US president’s visit to Gulf energy giants this week could send crude prices swinging.

】

item.title: 美国关税休战，高盛、摩根大通上调中国经济增长预期
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and other major banks boosted their growth forecasts for China’s economy, citing a temporary deal with the US to de-escalate their trade conflict.】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油出口价值再次因价格下跌而缩水
item.description:
尽管流量上升，但原油运输收益仍接近两年低点

Earnings from crude shipments remain near two-year low despite uptick in flows

】

item.title: 理疗应用制造商 Hinge Health 与支持者寻求 4.37 亿美元 IPO
item.description: Hinge Health 公司和一批投资者正在寻求在这家数字物理治疗提供商的美国首次公开募股中筹集多达 4.37 亿美元的资金。【原文：Hinge Health Inc. and a group of investors are seeking to raise as much as $437 million in the digital physical therapy provider’s US initial public offering.】

item.title: 亚洲和澳大利亚不会等待美国在儿童安全问题上发挥领导作用
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社遍布全球的记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，纽利-珀内尔（Newley Purnell）在香港关注亚太地区各国政府对儿童安全的推动。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Newley Purnell in Hong Kong looks at the push for child safety spanning governments across the Asia-Pacific region.】

item.title: 中美贸易休战的启示
item.description: 我是驻悉尼的国际经济企业编辑马尔科姆-斯科特（Malcolm Scott）。今天我们将探讨中美贸易休战的主要启示。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics enterprise editor in Sydney. Today we’re looking at key takeaways from the US-China trade truce. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 将中国商品运往美国的泛太平洋竞赛白热化
item.description: 周一宣布的中美关税休战在太平洋两岸掀起了一场争相在 90 天窗口期内运输商品的热潮，这个窗口期一直延续到夏末的海运贸易旺季。【原文：The US-China tariff truce announced Monday set off a scramble on both sides of the Pacific to ship merchandise during a 90-day window that extends into the late-summer peak season for seaborne trade.】

item.title: 卡通网络的最后一搏
item.description:
这个无厘头的动画工厂曾经创造了无数的点击率、人才和利润。但是，随着大卫-扎斯拉夫（David Zaslav）从流媒体儿童节目中退出，该电视台的前景堪忧。【原文：

The irreverent animation factory once cranked out hits, talent and profits. But with David Zaslav’s retreat from streaming kids programming, the future of the network is in question.

】

item.title: 加拿大帝国商业银行聘请阿尔弗雷德-特拉布尔西（Alfred Traboulsi）领导美国投资银行业务
item.description: 加拿大帝国商业银行聘请 Alfred Traboulsi 领导其美国投资银行团队。【原文：Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce hired Alfred Traboulsi to lead its US investment-banking team.】

item.title: 戴比尔斯秘密向特定交易商出售打折钻石
item.description: 戴比尔斯公司一直在悄悄地以大幅降价的方式向少数客户出售毛坯钻石，这一极不寻常的举动加剧了整个行业的紧张局势，而该行业本已深陷危机之中。【原文：De Beers has been quietly selling rough diamonds at sharply marked-down prices to a small handful of customers, in a highly unusual move that’s fueling tensions across an industry already mired in crisis.】

item.title: 在美国关税影响之前，JLR 所有者的利润超出预期
item.description: 塔塔汽车公司（Tata Motors Ltd. ）上一季度的利润超出预期，这一业绩掩盖了该汽车制造商的高端产品捷豹路虎公司（Jaguar Land Rover）因关税相关的不确定性而面临的痛苦。【原文：Tata Motors Ltd. reported profit that beat expectations last quarter, a performance that masks the looming pain in the form of tariff-related uncertainties for the carmaker’s premium Jaguar Land Rover unit.】
